abstract: Pakistan hangs seven prisoners in crackdown on militants in wake of massacre at children's school in Peshawar; executions take place while Sec of State John Kerry is visiting nation for talks.
lead_paragraph: Pakistan lifted a six-year moratorium on executions after the Taliban assault on a school in Peshawar on Dec. 16 that killed 150 people, most of them children.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and MICHAEL R. GORDON

snippet: Pakistan lifted a six-year moratorium on executions after the Taliban assault on a school in Peshawar on Dec. 16 that killed 150 people, most of them children.

keywords.value: Army Public School and Degree College (Peshawar, Pakistan)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Pakistan Executes Terrorism Convicts During a Visit by Kerry
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Executes Terrorism Convicts During a Visit by Kerry
